Page Content: As a 70-year-old retiree, I recently had the pleasure of visiting Paris for the first time. It was a trip I had been looking forward to for years, and I was not disappointed. Here are some of my favorite attractions and activities that I would recommend to other seniors visiting the city.  First on my list is the Eiffel Tower. This iconic landmark is a must-see for anyone visiting Paris, and the views from the top are truly breathtaking. While there are stairs to the second level, I opted for the elevator, which was a bit pricier but much more comfortable for someone of my age. I recommend booking tickets in advance to avoid long lines.  Next up is the Louvre Museum. This museum is massive, so I recommend picking a few galleries that interest you and focusing on those. I spent most of my time in the Egyptian and Greek galleries, which were absolutely fascinating. The museum also offers guided tours and audio guides, which can be helpful for navigating the vast collection.  Another highlight of my trip was a visit to the Palace of Versailles. This grand palace is located just outside of Paris and is easily accessible by train. I recommend taking a guided tour to learn more about the history of the palace and its famous residents, including King Louis XIV. The gardens are also worth exploring, with beautiful fountains and sculptures.  For a more relaxed activity, I suggest taking a stroll along the Seine River.

The park is also home to several food vendors, so you can grab a bite to eat while you relax with your pet. The museums house an extensive collection of art and artifacts, including the famous Sistine Chapel. I recommend purchasing tickets in advance and taking a guided tour to avoid the crowds and make the most of your time.  The Trevi Fountain: This stunning fountain is a must-see for anyone visiting Rome. The fountain is located in the heart of the city and is surrounded by charming streets and shops.
